column4: Can I use Ubuntu 8.10 livecd for backing up my files on a EXT3 drive to a NTFS drive?
it did, weird I didn't read the word backing
you can copy files from Ext3 to NTFS that's easy to do
as long as Windows shut down the NTFS properly
didnt work in 7.04, just read only so trying 8.10 now
yeah the proper  read and write NTFS support didn't come along untill 7.10
why 8.10 and not 9.04  by the way  9.04 isn't that great really,  8.10 :)   and then do another clean install once 9.10 is out so you can have full Ext4 support and by default :)
cause i use a mac as my primary computer and need my movies and so from my ext3 drive to my htpc
so ntfs-3g is enabled by default? read write that is
by the way good idea to md5sum your ISO
download check to make sure no problems with the ISO
